revised_title: Inheritance and Expression of Color Patterns in Acidalia Virgularia Moths
tldr: The author conducted experiments on cross-breeding two races of the moth Acidalia virgularia. They observed that speckling is a dominant trait in the moth's color pattern, but occasionally, non-speckled moths can be dominant. The study also revealed that heterozygous individuals may sometimes be indistinguishable from recessive ones. The author believes that this variation can be found in wild specimens in England.
